data.title: GREAT PLACE GREAT FOOD NICE PEOPLE WHOM WORK THERE
data.text: I love the food the people there are so polite.the chicken the gyros are delicious.the jukebok plays all different kinds of music. the staff there are very considerate.

data.title: I predict:  REZA is the next Copperfield!!!
data.text: AWESOME illusions! Very personable and crowd inclusive show! LOVED every minute of it! Can hardly believe we had this kind of talent in DECATUR!!!

data.title: So much history
data.text: The Lincoln Square Theater is a great place to go see movies or attend a concert. It's a large theater with historic charm. We love their $5 classic movie Fridays!

data.title: Ghost Hunt
data.text: We have been on ghost hunts here twice when we attended the Haunted America Conference.  Each time we have had different experiences.  Would recommend coming here if you like history and the possibility of encountering a spirit or two.

data.title: One of my favorite places in Decatur
data.text: This Lincoln Square Theater is about 100 years old and is in downtown Decatur.  It is partly renovated and has a lot of history to its credit - from vaudeville to films and plays.  Currently, they are the largest screen in Decatur.  I love this place!  The current managers/board are bringing in older movies and charging $5 per ticket.  Of course, popcorn and drinks are also available.  But it is a great place to see a movie and help support the city's history and legacy.  And, if you happen to see something strange, there are ghost tours ...

data.title: Ghost hunt
data.text: We had a blast!! We went to the Friday the 13th night. We got to watch a classic movie and ghost hunt until 2am all for only $30. The theatre is beautiful and it was such a privilege to get to hunt this place.

data.title: a bit of cinematic history
data.text: over 100 years old .......originally a vaudeville theater ..........still in use today for live performances and film ...

data.title: If You Love History!
data.text: If you love history this old theater is loaded with it! Beautiful architecture and the acoustics are phenomenal! So glad this piece of history is being preserved for Decatur! Rumor has it it is also haunted...
